page.title: 09HOME LIFE(2)
page.content: Although everyone likes living in Killinghall few would like to see any future growth in the village. Most wish to retain the smsll quiet village atmosphere. This would be vastly improved by the building of a by-pass to tale away the everincreasing traffic. The bus service is used by a decreasing number of people but to these it is a very important service. Only about a third of the village class themselves as churchgoers, about 103 being Anglicans, 50 Methodists, and only three Catholics.
